main.name: Matt Holden
main.jobDescription: learned some of today's most in demand software engineering skills.
main.contactmessage: Think I'd be a good fit for your team? Have a project for me? I would love to hear from you!  Reach out by email or by using the form below if you would like to get in touch with me.

resume.skillmessage: Much like traveling, I am always interested in expanding my skill set and exploring new technologies.  These are some of the languages, tools and platforms that I have experience with:

education.degree: Remote Software Engineering Immersive Flex Course
Bachelors of Science in Business Administration

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in small teams and have toyed around with contributing to Open Source Projects.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: JavaScript was my first programming language that I started using in college years ago. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: React JS
skills.description: I am fairly new to React and really did not like it at first. It has grown on me though and I will continue to use it going forward. I have built a ReactJS based resume-website template (link below in portfolio) which I used as a starting point for this personal site.

skills.name: NodeJS
skills.description: Node JS is my server-side scripting language of choice. The bulk of my experience with it has been in conjunction with MeteorJS-based projects

skills.name: Heroku
skills.description: I use Heroku as my hosting platform for most of my projects because so far they are all unpaid and their free tier is convenient. I also appreciate its integration with Github for such simple deployment.

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: I have used many different database systems and am better educated and experienced with Relational Databases. However, for many applications, the ease of use of MongoDB better suits my needs and it is much more enjoyable to work with

projects.title: Bash! The Flash Cards
projects.description: This web application was built as my first project in General Assembly's Software Engineering Immersive Course! A flash cards game to test your knowledge on basic software engineering.

projects.title: Allergy Busters
projects.description: Allergy Busters is an app created in collaboration with a team. This project is an app that allows users to track their daily habits, environmental factors, and potential irritants in order to help them better understand the causes of a particular allergy/intolerance they may have.
projects.technologies: JavaScript, React, CSS & Bootstrap, Express, MongoDB, Node
